title: Joseph Hawcridge
text:
John Joseph "Joe" Hawcridge (28 September 1863 – 1 January 1905), also known by the <a href="nickname">nickname</a> of the "Artful Dodger", was an English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer who played in the 1880s. He played at representative level for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Bradford%20Park%20Avenue%20A.F.C.">Bradford F.C.</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Three-quarters">three-quarter</a>, i.e. <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Wing">wing</a> or <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Centre">centre</a>. Prior to Tuesday 27 August 1895, Bradford F.C. was a <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> club, it then became a rugby league club, and since 1907 it has been the <a href="association%20football">association football</a> (soccer) club <a href="Bradford%20Park%20Avenue%20A.F.C.">Bradford Park Avenue</a>.
Background.
Joe Hawcridge was born in <a href="Macclesfield">Macclesfield</a>, <a href="Cheshire">Cheshire</a>, and he died aged 41 in <a href="San%20Francisco">San Francisco</a>, United States.
Playing career.
International honours.
Joe Hawcridge won caps for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> while at Bradford F.C. in 1885 against Wales, and Ireland.
Change of Code.
When Bradford F.C. converted from the <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> code to the <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> code on Tuesday 27 August 1895, Joe Hawcridge would have been approximately 31. Consequently, he could have been both a rugby union and rugby league footballer for Bradford F.C.
In the early years of rugby football the "goal" was to score goals, and a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> had zero value, but it provided the opportunity to "try" at goal, and "<a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">convert</a>" the try to a goal with an unopposed kick at the goal posts. The point values of both the try and goal have varied over time, and in the early years footballers could "score" a try, without scoring any points.
Genealogical information.
Joe Hawcridge's marriage to Helena Jane (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> Wilkinson) (born first ¼ 1868 in <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a> – died July–September 1937 (age 69) in <a href="Wharfedale">Wharfedale</a>) was registered during first ¼ 1888 in <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a> district.
Note.
Joe Hawcridge's surname is variously spelt correctly with a "c" as Hawcridge, or incorrectly with a "k" Hawkridge.
